answer_html: This occurs when the x value is 0 or \(\pi\).
answer_latex:
This
occurs when the \emph{x} value is 0 or $\pi$.
hints_html: Recall that the x-intercepts are found by setting the function to zero and solving.
hints_latex:
Recall that the \emph{x}-intercepts are found by setting the function to
zero and solving.
hints_raw: Recall that the ''x''-intercepts are found by setting the function to zero and solving.
question: 3 (a)
sols_html:
The function has x-intercepts whenever

\(0 = \frac{\sin(x)}{e^{x}}\)

This occurs whenever \(\sin(x) = 0\) on the interval \([0, \pi]\). This occurs when the x value is 0 or \(\pi\).
sols_latex:
The function has \emph{x}-intercepts whenever

$0 = \frac{\sin(x)}{e^{x}}$

This occurs whenever $\sin(x) = 0$ on the interval $[0, \pi]$. This
occurs when the \emph{x} value is 0 or $\pi$.
sols_raw:
The function has ''x''-intercepts whenever

<math>
0 = \frac{\sin(x)}{e^{x}}
</math>

This occurs whenever <math> \sin(x) = 0 </math> on the interval <math> [0, \pi]</math>. This occurs when the ''x'' value is 0 or <math> \pi </math>.
statement_html:
Let \(f(x) = \frac{\sin(x)}{e^{x}}\) on the interval \([0, \pi]\). In this question you will sketch this function.

(a) Find the x-intercepts of \(f(x)\), if any exist.
statement_latex:
Let $f(x) = \frac{\sin(x)}{e^{x}}$ on the interval $[0, \pi]$. In this
question you will sketch this function.

\textbf{(a)} Find the \emph{x}-intercepts of $f(x)$, if any exist.
statement_raw:
Let <math> f(x) = \frac{\sin(x)}{e^{x}} </math> on the interval <math> [0, \pi] </math>. In this question you will sketch this function.

'''(a)''' Find the ''x''-intercepts of <math>f(x) </math>, if any exist.
